sameAnalysis.word_list: also, too, as well, either, likewise
means: also ：比too正式一些，语气较重，只用于肯定句，一般紧靠动词。
too ：语气较轻，多用于口语，在肯定句中使用，通常位于句末。
as well ：一般不用否定句，通常放在句末，强调时可放在句中。
either ：用于否定句，放在句末，之前加逗号。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个副词均可表示"大，很"之意。
means: too ： 指超过了承受能力或程度，即程度加到了不适当的地步。
very ： 用于加强程度，可修饰褒义词和贬义词。

entry.def: You use too after mentioning another person, thing, or aspect that a previous statement applies to or includes.

example.ex: 'Nice to talk to you.' — 'Nice to talk to you too.'...
'I've got a great feeling about it.'  — 'Me too.'...
example.tran: “我感觉这次一定没问题。”——“我也是。”

entry.def: You use too after adding a piece of information or a comment to a statement, in order to emphasize that it is surprising or important.
entry.tran: (用于补充性信息或评论之后，表示强调)而且，还

example.ex: We did learn to read, and quickly too...
example.tran: 我们确实学会了阅读，而且学得很快。

example.ex: People usually think of it as a 'boys' book', which of course it is, and a very good one too.
example.tran: 人们通常把它看作“男孩读物”，它当然是，而且还是本很不错的男孩读物。

entry.def: You use too at the end of a sentence to emphasize an opinion that you have added after a statement made by you or by another person.

example.ex: 'That money's mine.' — 'Of course it is, and quite right too.'...
example.tran: “那笔钱是我的。”——“当然是你的，而且也理应如此。”

example.ex: 'Oh excuse me.' — 'I should think so too.'...
example.tran: “哦，请原谅。”——“你确实应该感到抱歉。”

entry.def: You use too in order to emphasize in a humorous or childish way that you disagree with what someone else has said or that you refuse to obey them.
entry.tran: (幽默或孩子气地坚持己见)确实地，无可否认地

example.ex: 'I'm getting a bike for my birthday.' — 'You are not.' – 'I am too.'
example.tran: “我过生日想要一辆自行车。”——“不行。”——“我就要。”

entry.def: You use too in order to indicate that there is a greater amount or degree of something than is desirable, necessary, or acceptable.

example.ex: Leather jeans that are too big will make you look larger...
example.tran: 过于肥大的皮裤会让你看起来块头更大。

example.ex: Eggs shouldn't be kept in the fridge, it's too cold...
example.tran: 鸡蛋不应保存在冰箱里，温度太低了。

entry.def: You use too with a negative to make what you are saying sound less forceful or more polite or cautious.
entry.tran: (与否定词连用，表示缓和语气、礼貌或谨慎)太，十分

example.ex: Americans are never too keen to leave their beloved country…
example.tran: 美国人从不急于离开他们热爱的国家。

example.ex: I wasn't too happy with what I'd written so far...
example.tran: 我对于目前已写完的这些并不太满意。

entry.def: You use too when you want to emphasize in a fairly formal way your thanks to someone for something that they have done for you.
entry.tran: (表示感谢，较为正式)极其，非常

example.ex: 'I'll try and get you a cake.' — 'Oh Ann you're too kind.'
example.tran: “我会设法为你弄来一个蛋糕。”——“噢，安，你真是太好了。”

entry.def: You use all too or only too to emphasize that something happens to a greater extent or degree than is pleasant or desirable.

example.ex: She remembered it all too well...
She is all too aware that we should be grateful for good health…
example.tran: 我们应对健康的身体心存感恩，这一点她太清楚了。

entry.def: If you describe a situation as too little too late, you are blaming someone for not doing enough to prevent a problem and for taking action only after the problem had become very bad.

example.ex: They think this is too little too late…
example.tran: 他们认为这已经为时已晚了。
